title: Reception: Project X | Xtreme Archive & Chi Kai-Yuan | Exercise Trilogy
desc: Exhibition: November 9 - December 11, 2015 Main Gallery   Atrium Gallery Free and open to the public. Kindle RSVP. : Concluding their curatorial residency at 18th Street Arts Center,   presents Xtreme Archive: Project X 1992-1999, an exhibition of ephemera, images, and audio recordings about the exhibitions of Project X in the nineties. The Curator in Residence program at 18th Street Arts Center is generously supported by the the Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts and the National Endowment for the Arts. Chi Kai-Yuan is a Taiwanese artist at 18th Street as a visiting artist until January 3, 2016. He received a Master of Arts at the National Changhua University of Education. Chi?s work concerns space, objects, and mass public. In daily situations, these things are the vibes to inspire creativity, which Chi sees as targets, and get close to them through various techniques at different distances, including linguistic exchange, site-specific production, event actions, critical discourse as well as other artistic methods to interpret. This residency and exhibition at has been generously funded by Taiwan Academy in Los Angeles and the Ministry of Culture Taiwan.
